page.title: 09PLACES OF INTEREST.
page.content: The small stone{church of St.Cuthbert stands overlooking the township of Bellingham.Parts of the church date back to the eleventh century.It has a stone roof,unique in England which was put up to replace the wooden roof which was so regularly burned down by the Scots on their border raids.Canon balls were found on the roof when it was replaced in 1861. In the church yard can be seen the {long pack grave. } (see page 10) A narrow path outside the church leads down to Cuddies Well(see page 10).The water from this well is supposed to cure illnesses and is still used for baptisms. Outside the Town Hall stands an antique gun captured from the Chinese during the Boxer Rebellion and presented to the town by Admiral Sir Edward Charlton of Hesleyside.
